    • Method Detail

      • convertMultiByteToInt

        public static int convertMultiByteToInt(int[] bytes)
        There is a slight problem with this method that you might have noticed; a Java int is signed, so we can't make use of the 32nd bit. This means we this method does not support a four byte value with msb greater than 01111111 ((2^7-1) or 127).

        TODO use long instead of int to support 4 bytes values. note that long assignments are not atomic.

      • convertMultiByteToLong

      • fromBase16toByteArray

        public static byte[] fromBase16toByteArray(java.lang.String bytes)
        This method return a byte[] from a String. It support the format
        of the toBase16(byte[]) and in general it supports the following java.util.regex.Pattern:
        \s*((0x[0-9a-f]{2}|[0-9a-f]{2})\s*)+
        Exmaple: 
         0x23 0xab 0xfE 0xDD
 0x23 0xab 0xfe 0xdd
 0x23 ab 0xfE DD
        NOTE
        The main difference with fromBase16toIntArray(String) is that the data returned
        is signed, so values goes from -128 to 127
        Parameters:
        bytes - the String representing the bytes in hex form
        Returns:
        the formatted bytes
        Since:
        0.6.0 - Revision 60

      • toBase16

        public static boolean getBit(int b,
             int position)
        Returns true if the bit is on (1) at the specified position Position range: 1-8

      • isByteValue

        public static boolean isByteValue(int b)
        Parameters:
        b - the int value to check if it contains a byte representable value
        Returns:
        true if the value of the int could be expressed with 8 bits
        Since:
        0.8.0
